steps.title: The Cloudify Console
steps.content: This tour reviews the areas of the Cloudify Console. Let's get started...

steps.title: Console pages
steps.content: Here you can click on a page to work with a specific group of Cloudify actions, such as Local Blueprints or Deployments. Administrators can customize the pages to help streamline your work.

steps.title: Widgets on the pages
steps.content: On each page is a set of widgets. Each widget lets you do a specific Cloudify action. Widgets are grouped on the page so that you can easily access related actions. Administrators can also customize the widgets on each page to meet your needs.

steps.title: Manager services status
steps.content: Here you can quickly review the status of the Cloudify services to see if there is anything that needs attention.

steps.title: Switch to other tenants
steps.content: If you can access multiple tenants on the Cloudify Manager, here you can select the tenant that you want to work on.

steps.title: Get help
steps.content: If you need more information about using the Console or the Cloudify Manager, here you can find links to documentation, video tutorials, and knowledge base articles.

steps.title: User menu
steps.content: The user menu here gives you access to customizing pages and page templates if your user roles allow those actions. It is also where you logout.

steps.title: Next steps...
steps.content: Now that you know the structure of the console, check out other tours about working with the Cloudify Console.

steps.title: The Cloudify Console Dashboard
steps.content: The Cloudify Console dashboard contains widgets that do basic actions and show the status of selected tenant. Let's see what the widgets are...

steps.title: Tenant resource load
steps.content: Here you can see how many blueprints, deployments, plugins are available, and you can see how many nodes and executions are running currently. These statistics can indicate the load on the tenant.

steps.title: Resource actions
steps.content: You can upload blueprints, create deployments and upload plugins straight from the dashboard.

steps.title: Deployments
steps.content: These are the deployments that are currently available on your tenant. Click on the menu to run an execution.

steps.title: Execution filters
steps.content: Here you can filter the executions and events to show only those that are related to a specific blueprint or deployment.

steps.title: Executions
steps.content: These are the executions that the tenant is implementing currently.

steps.title: Check out another tour
steps.content: Now that you know how to use the dashboard, check out another tour to see what else you can do with the Cloudify Console.
